result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul J Sorenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Court grants expungement after one year, defendant is to have no future criminal offenses, after payment of all monies due and completion of the AODA & any follow-up recommendations and filing the required proof with DA's office and COC office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul J Sorenson

defendant.name: Sorenson, Paul J
defendant.address: N5598 Fairway Dr, New London, WI 54961

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant
No Appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.
After one year, if defendant has complied with all conditions.

11:44 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge, with a fine, costs, DNA sample and AODA.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs and requests expungement after one year.  Defendant concurs. 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-AODA - Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.

-Court grants expungement after one year, defendnat is to have no future criminal offenses, after payment of all monies due and completion of the AODA & any follow-up recommendations and filing the required proof with DA's office and COC office.

Court adjourned at 11:50 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2016 at 11:30 am.

11:37 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by AttyRoeth - have received Discovery and an offer and requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on October 11, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:38 a.m.
Status hearing on August 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.

8:44 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty oey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Roeth confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Roeth enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on August 30, 2016 at 11:00 a.m..

Court adjourned at 8:45 a.m.
